fragmentEntries.title: Diamond Challenge
fragmentEntries.description: Global entrepreneurship competition for high school students to pitch business or social venture ideas (in Business or Social tracks) for a $100,000 prize pool. Teams submit a business concept and pitch to judges.

fragmentEntries.title: Technovation Girls
fragmentEntries.description: Global technology entrepreneurship competition where teams of girls (ages 10–18) develop a mobile app or AI project to solve a community problem. Winners can earn scholarships and a trip to the World Summit.

fragmentEntries.title: Conrad Challenge
fragmentEntries.description: International entrepreneurship competition for teams of 2–5 students to develop innovative solutions in categories like Aerospace, Energy, Health, etc. Finalists pitch at the Innovation Summit and compete for scholarships and prizes.

fragmentEntries.title: Google Code Jam
fragmentEntries.description: Global coding competition where programmers of all levels solve algorithmic puzzles to earn a spot at World Finals. Winner receives $15k.

fragmentEntries.title: CalTech Up Close
fragmentEntries.description: FGLI, minority, and STEM student fly-in program. Decisions released in September.

fragmentEntries.title: TeenLife Blog
fragmentEntries.description: Articles and guides about summer programs and other opportunities for high school students across various interests.

fragmentEntries.title: Travel for Teens
fragmentEntries.description: Offers teen travel programs focused on cultural immersion, service, language learning, and adventure.

fragmentEntries.title: Pathway to Science
fragmentEntries.description: A curated database of research and enrichment programs for high school students interested in STEM fields.

fragmentEntries.title: Travel Abroad
fragmentEntries.description: International immersion programs combining language learning, cultural exchange, and service projects. 2025 trips available across multiple destinations.
